Bangladesh: Rule of the Hussain Shahi dynasty. (to 1538)
Brazil: Treaty of Tordesillas: Spain and Portugal divide the New World between themselves. Even though the treaty was negotiated without consulting the Pope, a few sources call the resulting line the "Papal Line of Demarcation".
France: Charles VIII begins the first of the Italian Wars by invading Italy, but is eventually repulsed by the League of Venice.
Ireland: Edward Poyning, Henry VII of England's Lord Deputy to Ireland, issued a declaration known as Poynings' Law under which the Irish parliament was to pass no law without the prior consent of the English parliament.
Italy: The Italian War of 1494–98, or First Italian War, begins, marking the first major battle in the Italian Wars.
Spain: The Treaty of Tordesillas was signed.
